remarks: The principle of founded induction.  Theorem 4.4 of Don Monk's notes (see ~ frmin ).  This principle states that if ` B ` is a subclass of a founded class ` A ` with the property that every element of ` B ` whose initial segment is included in ` A ` is itself equal to ` A ` .  Compare ~ wfi and ~ tfi , which are special cases of this theorem that do not require the axiom of infinity to prove.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 6-Feb-2011.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
statement:
frind $p |- ( ( ( R Fr A /\ R Se A ) /\ ( B C_ A /\ A. y e. A ( Pred ( R , A , y ) C_ B -> y e. B ) ) ) -> A = B ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B y $.
$d R y $.
